info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 13 at 10:26PM EDT until August 14 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following counties, Henderson and Transylvania.
* WHEN...Until 115 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1020 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Brevard, Mills River, Flat Rock, Etowah, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Saluda, Rosman, Dupont State Forest, Jones Gap State Park, Caesars Head State Park, Looking Glass, B.R. Parkway-Black Balsam To Mount Pisgah, Bat Cave, Chimney Rock State Park, Valley Hill, Little River In Transylvania County, Crab Creek and Horse Shoe. - Main streams and rivers that may be impacted include Little River in eastern Transylvania County, Sentell Creek in western Henderson County, and Mud Creek near Hendersonville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT THURSDAY
